newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Creative Tech jumps.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Creative Tech jumps.

text.p: Singapore software company Creative Technology Ltd rose on Thursday amid mixed overall trade in American Depositary Receipts.

Traders said the ADR markets were largely marking time ahead of Friday's release of U.S. employment data. If the numbers indicate a rise in inflation, they could mean a further hike in U.S. interest rates.
"I think people are thinking to be a bit flattish before the numbers tomorrow," a trader said.
A trader in Latin American ADRs said there was little new money entering the markets.
"Everyone is sitting on the sidelines ahead of the numbers. People are just trading, punting around," he said.
Creative Technology rose 1-1/2 to 10-5/8 after it said it expected to report strong financial earnings for its third quarter ended March 31.
Volume was heavy at mid-morning and the ADRs were among the most active on Wall Street.
Swedish telephone equipment maker LM Ericsson rose 3/8 to 32-3/4 after it reported it had won a big Russian contract. Finland's Nokia Group rose 5/8 to 56-3/8.
Latin American ADRs were mixed. Brazilian bellwether Telebras SA rose 7/8 to 107-1/2 after the country's Supreme Court ruled that a selloff of cellular telephone concessions could go forward.
Troubled Canadian mining company Bre-X Minerals rose 3/16 to 2-1/2.
Decliners led advancers 229 to 171 among 806 ADRs. The ADR index was up 0.01 percent and volume was 23 million shares at mid-morning.
